answerText: Happy Days[10] In this play, by the same author as Happy Days, one character responds to another character's requests to look outside by saying "Zero."  It centers on the constantly fighting Clov and Hamm.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 11 | 18 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One character in this play tries to make out the writing on a toothbrush using a magnifying glass, eventually lamenting that her breasts and arms are become submerged beneath a mound of dirt.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this play featuring Winnie, Willie, and a music box that plays "I Love You So" from Lehar's The Merry Widow, which Winnie sings near its end.
